examples: English stills bears the imprint of the Norman invasion

definitions.text: a concavity in a surface produced by pressing
examples: he left the impression of his fingers in the soft mud

definitions.text: an identification of a publisher; a publisher's name along with the date and address and edition that is printed at the bottom of the title page
examples: the book was published under a distinguished imprint

definitions.text: an impression produced by pressure or printing
a device produced by pressure on a surface
establish or impress firmly in the mind
examples: We imprint our ideas onto our children

definitions.text: mark or stamp with or as if with pressure
examples: To make a batik, you impress a design with wax
